meanings.definition: The act of firing a gun or other weapon.
meanings.sent1: During the shooting, the loud bang scared the birds away.
meanings.sent2: The police officer practiced shooting at the target range.
meanings.sent3: The shooting in the action movie looked so real, it made me jump!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were shooting daggers at him, showing her anger.
meanings.sent5: The shooting echoed through the forest, signaling the start of the hunting season.

meanings.definition: The act of hitting a target with a projectile.
meanings.sent1: His accurate shooting skills impressed everyone at the carnival.
meanings.sent2: The archer's shooting was so precise that he hit the bullseye every time.
meanings.sent3: The shooting contest at the fair was a fun way to test our aim.
meanings.sent4: Her shooting star necklace reminded her to always aim high in life.
meanings.sent5: The shooting of the basketball soared through the hoop, scoring the winning point.

meanings.definition: The act of photographing or filming.
meanings.sent1: The shooting of the sunset was breathtaking, capturing its beauty.
meanings.sent2: The director discussed the shooting schedule with the film crew.
meanings.sent3: The shooting of the documentary took place in various locations around the world.
meanings.sent4: Her camera was shooting non-stop to capture every moment of the event.
meanings.sent5: The shooting of the commercial involved multiple takes to get the perfect shot.
